<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/13/first-covid19-vaccines-delivered?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hope Looks Like an 18-Wheeler
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nancy Galloway (L) and Susan Deur cheer as trucks carrying the first shipment of the Covid-19 vaccine that is being escorted by the US Marshals Service, leave Pfizer's Global Supply facility in Kalamazoo, MI." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDA0L3BmaXplcl92YWNjaW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jeff Kowalsky/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday morning, about 36 hours after the FDA granted emergency authorization, the <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/pfizer-biontech-coronavirus-vaccine-ships-to-states?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first truck</a> carrying Pfizer-BioNTech's Covid-19 vaccine departed Kalamazoo, MI. Altogether, around 3 million doses will snake their way to 636 distribution centers across the country in the coming days.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>UPS and FedEx, which are handling last-mile deliveries, will drop off extra dry ice for recipients, and medical supplier McKesson will deliver syringes, alcohol pads, and other supplies. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The vaccine requires two shots a month apart, so officials are saving the second half of the ~6.4 million doses planned for the first wave to send out in a few weeks. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bingo nights could return soon</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most states are expected to follow <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/cdc-vaccine-panel-votes-prioritize-healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CDC guidance</a> and vaccinate healthcare workers and staff and residents of long-term care facilities first. Next week, CVS and Walgreens pharmacists will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/12/health/covid-vaccine-first.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begin vaccinations</a> at 75,000 long-term care facilities in most parts of the country, a process CVS estimates will take 9–12 weeks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The FDA warned that people with a history of severe allergic reactions to the vaccine's components should wait. And it'll still take months to produce enough doses to cover other high-risk groups (like the elderly, essential workers, and people with underlying conditions), let alone the broader population.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The remaining challenges</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spoilage:</strong> Pfizer's vaccine needs to maintain -94°F, and although the company has <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/trucks-first-covid-19-vaccine-060010624.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">equipped</a> shipping containers with dry ice and GPS-enabled temperature sensors, it's expected that some doses won't survive the journey. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Supply chain: </strong>In 2009, delivery timetables for the swine flu vaccine shifted regularly. The same hurdles are expected <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/12/11/covid19-vaccine-timeline-keeps-slipping-experts-say-it-will-change-again/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this time around</a>: Each batch manufactured in a different facility must be tested for quality control, which takes time. And packaging, dry ice, glass vials, and other materials face their own supply chain constraints. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Funding: </strong>State health officials <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/11/health/pfizer-vaccine-authorized.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> Congress for $8.4 billion to help pay for staff to administer vaccines and track data. So far, they've received $350 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>on Thursday, the FDA is scheduled to review Moderna's vaccine, which was about as effective as Pfizer's in clinical trials. It's expected to get approval. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/13/george-senate-races-attracting-attention-corporate-america?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Georgia on Our Minds
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="MARIETTA, GA - NOVEMBER 11:  Republican U.S. Senate candidate Kelly Loef..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDA1L2dlb3JnaWFfZ29wX3NlbmF0ZV9jYW5kaWQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jessica Mcgowan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The runoff races in Georgia are set to become some of the <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/b34d23f6-ca4a-45e7-af1c-b328564df197?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most expensive Senate campaigns</a> in history, per AdImpact data cited by the Financial Times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The races, which remain undecided from Election Day in November, pit Republicans Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue against Democrats Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff, respectively. The stakes are high: If the GOP can hold onto one of those seats, they'll eke out a majority in the Senate and be in a better position to push back on President-elect Joe Biden's agenda. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With lots on the line, the race has drawn interest (and $$$) from corporate America. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On the GOP side, Blackstone's Stephen Schwarzman and Citadel's Ken Griffin are among the top donors to a political action committee (PAC) linked to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Netflix CEO Reed Hastings contributed $500,000 to a Democratic PAC, but the party is focusing more on small-donor support. Its online fundraising platform processed nearly $112 million in donations from Nov. 4 to Nov. 23 (the GOP equivalent processed $55.6 million).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the vote is scheduled for Jan. 5, but in-person early voting starts today.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKET
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/13/roblox-affirm-delay-ipos-early-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
IPNo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend, gaming platform Roblox and fintech startup Affirm postponed their highly anticipated IPOs until early 2021, the WSJ <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/affirm-postpones-initial-public-offering-sources-say-11607801619?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. Not what you were expecting after Airbnb’s and DoorDash's graph-smashing debuts last week?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Actually, some investors are worried the IPO market is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/11/popping-ipo-market-broken?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a little <em>too</em> hot</a> right now. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">BlackRock CEO Larry Fink</strong></span><span>: Recent prices are "</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-11/blackrock-s-fink-says-ipo-fever-could-end-in-many-accidents?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unsustainable</a></span><span>" and "there are going to be many accidents."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Famed venture capitalist Bill Gurley</strong></span><span>: "Two high-profile companies voluntarily </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/bgurley/status/1337940542378807296?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delay</a></span><span> their IPO because broken process repeatedly creates massive mispricings that come from pockets of company's founders, employees, & shareholders."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Affirm and Roblox were hoping for valuations as high as $10 billion and $8 billion, respectively. Recent IPO trends may lead them to sell more shares or price them differently.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> The pandemic has been kind to tech IPOs. Three of the biggest ever in terms of capital raised took place this year (Airbnb, DoorDash, and Snowflake). Valuations relative to revenue are the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/sizzling-tech-ipo-market-leaves-investors-befuddled-11607868001?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest</a> since the dot-com bubble. And even companies that make no money are soaring: At least three electric vehicle companies worth more than $2 billion have no revenue.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/kevin-office-will-bring-1-million-cameo-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TFW You Are a Cameo Legend
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Kevin on the office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=382 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11zU4IDJeg75Sg/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Kevin on the office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11zU4IDJeg75Sg/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brian Baumgartner, the actor who played Kevin on <em>The Office</em>, will make more than $1 million on celebrity booking site Cameo this year, CEO Steven Galanis <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/07/opinion/sway-kara-swisher-steven-galanis.html?showTranscript=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> on the podcast, <em>Sway</em>. That makes him the platform's top earner of 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Baumgartner has been successful, Galanis says, because he "takes a lot of pride in his craftsmanship of the videos." And he works hard. Since he charges $195/video, we estimate Baumgartner will have averaged at least 14 videos per day in 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are a few other juicy details about Cameo:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>YouTuber David Dobrik is the most-requested celebrity that's not on the platform. He's requested "way more than a Beyonce or a J. Lo.," said Galanis.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But Galanis thinks President Trump would crush Dobrik if he joined Cameo. Fifteen Trump impersonators have collectively done $3.2 million this year in gross merchandise value.</span></li>
</ul>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Electoral college: </strong>Today, the 538 members of the Electoral College will officially <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/electoral-college-meets-monday-expect/story?id=74655917&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cast their votes</a> for president and vice-president. Joe Biden is expected to get 306 electoral votes to President Trump's 232 (270 is the threshold for victory).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tesla gets promoted: </strong>On Friday, Elon Musk's $578 billion electric automaker will join the S&P 500 index. And it's going to be a wild scene—investors <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/global-markets-themes-idCNL8N2IR1TN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could trade</a> more than $50 billion in a matter of minutes to make room for Tesla in their portfolios.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fed meeting: </strong>The U.S. central bank will meet for the final time this year on Tuesday and Wednesday. What's the buzz? That the Fed could announce a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/11/congres-fe.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweak</a> to its bond-buying program, shifting more focus to longer-dated Treasuries in order to keep yields down. So, yeah, not a lot of buzz.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Christopher Nolan's </span><span><em>Tenet</em></span><span> will be released digitally on Tuesday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A major snowstorm could hit the East Coast mid-week.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Friday is National Ugly Sweater Day.</span></li>
</ul>

than a college graduation ceremony. Their joint statement sums up the situation well: \"Despite the exhaustion after almost a year of negotiations, despite the fact that deadlines have been missed over and over, we think it is responsible at this point to go the extra mile.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStocks: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou won't see it in the chart above, but the small-cap Russell 2000 is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/americas-small-stocks-are-leading-the-markets-charge-11607855400?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutperforming\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the S\u0026P 500 this year (up 15% vs. 13%). style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHEALTHCARE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/13/first-covid19-vaccines-delivered?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHope Looks Like an 18-Wheeler\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Nancy Galloway (L) and Susan Deur cheer as trucks carrying the first shipment of the Covid-19 vaccine that is being escorted by the US Marshals Service, leave Pfizer's Global Supply facility in Kalamazoo, MI.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDA0L3BmaXplcl92YWNjaW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJeff Kowalsky/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday morning, about 36 hours after the FDA granted emergency authorization, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/pfizer-biontech-coronavirus-vaccine-ships-to-states?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst truck\u003c/a\u003e carrying Pfizer-BioNTech's Covid-19 vaccine departed Kalamazoo, MI. Altogether, around 3 million doses will snake their way to 636 distribution centers across the country in the coming days.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUPS and FedEx, which are handling last-mile deliveries, will drop off extra dry ice for recipients, and medical supplier McKesson will deliver syringes, alcohol pads, and other supplies. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe vaccine requires two shots a month apart, so officials are saving the second half of the ~6.4 million doses planned for the first wave to send out in a few weeks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBingo nights could return soon\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost states are expected to follow \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/cdc-vaccine-panel-votes-prioritize-healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCDC guidance\u003c/a\u003e and vaccinate healthcare workers and staff and residents of long-term care facilities first. Next week, CVS and Walgreens pharmacists will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/12/health/covid-vaccine-first.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegin vaccinations\u003c/a\u003e at 75,000 long-term care facilities in most parts of the country, a process CVS estimates will take 9–12 weeks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe FDA warned that people with a history of severe allergic reactions to the vaccine's components should wait. And it'll still take months to produce enough doses to cover other high-risk groups (like the elderly, essential workers, and people with underlying conditions), let alone the broader population.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe remaining challenges\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpoilage:\u003c/strong\u003e Pfizer's vaccine needs to maintain -94°F, and although the company has \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/trucks-first-covid-19-vaccine-060010624.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eequipped\u003c/a\u003e shipping containers with dry ice and GPS-enabled temperature sensors, it's expected that some doses won't survive the journey. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSupply chain: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2009, delivery timetables for the swine flu vaccine shifted regularly. The same hurdles are expected \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/12/11/covid19-vaccine-timeline-keeps-slipping-experts-say-it-will-change-again/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethis time around\u003c/a\u003e: Each batch manufactured in a different facility must be tested for quality control, which takes time. And packaging, dry ice, glass vials, and other materials face their own supply chain constraints. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFunding: \u003c/strong\u003eState health officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/11/health/pfizer-vaccine-authorized.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked\u003c/a\u003e Congress for $8.4 billion to help pay for staff to administer vaccines and track data. So far, they've received $350 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eon Thursday, the FDA is scheduled to review Moderna's vaccine, which was about as effective as Pfizer's in clinical trials. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe runoff races in Georgia are set to become some of #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost expensive Senate campaigns\u003c/a\u003e in history, per AdImpact data cited by the Financial Times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe races, which remain undecided from Election Day in November, pit Republicans Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue against Democrats Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff, respectively. The stakes are high: If the GOP can hold onto one of those seats, they'll eke out a majority in the Senate and be in a better position to push back on President-elect Joe Biden's agenda. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith lots on the line, the race has drawn interest (and $$$) from corporate America. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn the GOP side, Blackstone's Stephen Schwarzman and Citadel's Ken Griffin are among the top donors to a political action committee (PAC) linked to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNetflix CEO Reed Hastings contributed $500,000 to a Democratic PAC, but the party is focusing more on small-donor support. Its online fundraising platform processed nearly $112 million in donations from Nov. 4 to Nov. 23 (the GOP equivalent processed $55.6 million).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea little \u003cem\u003etoo\u003c/em\u003e hot\u003c/a\u003e right now. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBlackRock CEO Larry Fink\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: Recent prices are \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-11/blackrock-s-fink-says-ipo-fever-could-end-in-many-accidents?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunsustainable\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" and \"there are going to booking site Cameo this year, CEO Steven Galanis \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/07/opinion/sway-kara-swisher-steven-galanis.html?showTranscript=1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed\u003c/a\u003e on the podcast, \u003cem\u003eSway\u003c/em\u003e. That makes him the platform's top earner of 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBaumgartner has been successful, Galanis says, because he \"takes a lot of pride in his craftsmanship of the videos.\" And he works hard. Since he charges $195/video, we estimate Baumgartner will have averaged at least 14 videos per day in 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere are a few other juicy details about Cameo:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYouTuber David Dobrik is the most-requested celebrity that's not on the platform. He's requested \"way more than a Beyonce or a J. Lo.,\" said Galanis.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut Galanis thinks President Trump would crush Dobrik if he joined Cameo.
